intro: Erigeron multifolius, commonly known as the multileaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils. It features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers from late spring to early autumn. Erigeron multifolius is often found in dry to moist soils and is known for its ecological importance as a source of nectar for pollinators.
